Package it.polimi.se2019.view.cli

Class CliInputHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2019.view.cli.CliInputHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BotCliHandler
    public class CliInputHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Handles the input from the client in command line interface, supporting:
  • Choosing between CLI or GUI
  • Connection to the server and logging in
  • Selecting an options allowed from the backend
  • Showing info about the current state of the game, such as display another player's info

      • selectFromOptions

        private <T> boolean selectFromOptions​(java.lang.String[] toBeParsed,
                                      java.util.List<T> selected,
                                      SelectableOptions<T> selectableOptions)
        Edit a list of Objects, adding a list of T, using an array of string to be parsed, related to a selectableOptions
        Type Parameters:
        T - Element that contains the selected and will be parsed
        Parameters:
        toBeParsed - array of string containing chosen indexes
        selected - list to add the parsed element to
        selectableOptions - options to use to parse the element
        Returns:
        whether the input is right or not

        tiles - coordinates to parse

      • parseOption

        private java.lang.String parseOption​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> acceptedOptions,
                                     java.util.List<java.lang.String> bannedOptions,
                                     java.lang.String defaultChoice,
                                     java.lang.String inputChoice,
                                     java.lang.String description)
        Helper method that checks validity of user input
        Parameters:
        acceptedOptions - options that can be accepted
        bannedOptions - options that must be rejected. If null, reject all values not in acceptedOptions
        defaultChoice - option returned if inputChoice is not valid
        inputChoice - option to check
        description - description of option name
        Returns:
        inputChoice is valid

      • connectionChoice

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> connectionChoice​(java.io.BufferedReader input)
        Asks connection parameters with automatic default values
        Parameters:
        input - BufferedReader that reads input
        Returns:
        map of options selected by the player, that can be passed at the next invocation of the overloaded method as default values

      • connectionChoice

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> connectionChoice​(java.io.BufferedReader input,
                                                                        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> dv)
        Asks parameters to connect with custom default values provided with dv Asks in order:
      • Connection type (RMI/Socket)
      • Server url
      • Server port
      • Username
      • Password
      • Whether to re enter an existing match
      • Gamemode (Normal/Domination)
        • Then proceeds to connect to the server and get an EventUpdater
Parameters:
input - BufferedReader that reads input
dv - default values for asked parameters
Returns:
map of options selected by the player, that can be passed at the next invocation of this method as default values

  • viewChoice

    private boolean viewChoice()
    Handles the selectio of the cli or the gui
    Returns:
    whether the cli is selected

  • handleInput

    private void handleInput()
    Handles the input, parsing the parsed string till "quit" is read. Supports different modes:
  • Select mode, where user select an object to send to the server
  • Tile info mode, where user can request info about tiles
  • Player info mode, where users can request info about a player
  • Spawn info mode, where users can request info about a spawn
  • Weapon info mode, where users can request info about a weapon

  • setDefaultValues

    public void setDefaultValues​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> defaultValues)
    Set dv with custom values
    Parameters:
    defaultValues -

  • run

    public void run()
    Starts the CLI. It handles, in order:
  • Selecting CLI or GUI
  • Logging in
  • Handles input using handleInput()
  • Restarting the CLI if the connection did not go as expected
    • Specified by:
    run in interface java.lang.Runnable
